DOC.HEAD: ConAgra Reports Record Second-Quarter Earnings
DOC.TEXT: ConAgra Inc. said Monday its net income rose 12.8 percent for its second fiscal quarter, giving the diversified food conglomerate record earnings for the period. The Omaha-based company reported a profit of $63.9 million, or 52 cents per share, for the quarter ended Nov. 26, compared with $56.8 million, or 47 cents per share, in the same period last year. ConAgra reported sales of $3.86 billion for the quarter, up 36 percent from sales of $2.84 billion in last year's second fiscal quarter. For the first half of its fiscal year, net income was up 20 percent to $113.9 million, or 92 cents a share, from $95 million, or 79 cents a share, last year, the company said. Net sales were $7.87 billion, up 39 percent from $5.65 billion last year. Charles M. Harper, ConAgra's chairman and chief executive, attributed the results to ``ConAgra's food chain balance.'' ``As food industry conditions change, different ConAgra businesses come to the fore,'' he said. ``Fiscal 1990 is a case in point, and we continue to expect record earnings for the full year.'' He said there are many domestic and international opportunities for the company. ``For example, the current political trends in Eastern Europe hold considerable promise for a basic food company whose job is to help feed people better,'' he said.
